entries.meaning: (music) The circular rotating platform of a record player or a disk jockey's console on which the record rests during play; (by extension), a record player.
(rail transport, road transport) A rotating platform placed in a circular pit, used for turning locomotives, cars, or trucks.

verbs.description: turntable (third-person singular simple present turntables, present participle turntabling, simple past and past participle turntabled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, music) To play (a record) using a turntable.
(intransitive) To rotate or turn around using, or as if using, a turntable.
(intransitive, music) To manipulate sound using turntables; to perform turntablism; to scratch
